Description: Painted wooden shabti with a black lappet-wig, a red modelled face with black eyes, a yellow body and crossed red hands holding two red ploughs; the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs(very worn); the back is decorated with a representation of a red yoke with two nw-pots and a low-slung seed-basket.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore (perhaps)
